summary: Building 'MultiTiers', a website similar to MC Tiers — a tier-ranking/leaderboard platform for Minecraft players. The tier system is LT5/HT5/LT4/HT4/LT3/HT3/LT2/HT2/LT1/HT1. The leaderboard/tier list shows no entries by default. A Category filter (Sword, Axe, Crystal, Mace, Spearmace, Diamond SMP, UHC, SMP) is being added to the Tier List and Leaderboard pages, with an 'All' default view. A password-protected Admin/Management area is being added for adding and managing players.
architectural_notes: Project name is 'MultiTiers', inspired by MC Tiers — a competitive tier ranking website
Admin area is password-protected with password 65515616151, accessible only after correct password entry

existing_features.title: Create a top navigation bar with the 'MultiTiers' brand logo/wordmark, navigation links (Home, Leaderboard, Tier List), and a search input for filtering players/entries.

Build a Tier List page that displays players/entries grouped into tiers: S, A, B, C, and D. Each tier row must be visually distinct with a colored tier label and contain player cards showing the player name, rank badge, and rating score.
Build a Leaderboard page that displays a ranked table of all players/entries sorted by rating score descending. Each row should show position number, player name, tier label, and rating score.
Implement a search/filter feature that filters displayed players by name in real time on both the Tier List and Leaderboard views.

Apply a dark, high-contrast visual theme inspired by competitive gaming aesthetics. Use a near-black background, sharp typography (bold, uppercase headings), vivid accent colors for tier labels (e.g. gold for S, red for A, orange for B, teal for C, grey for D), and subtle glowing/gradient effects on cards and badges. Enforce this theme consistently across all pages and components.
Render the generated MultiTiers logo banner image as a static asset from frontend/public/assets/generated and display it in the navigation bar.

Replace the tier system throughout the entire codebase (backend and frontend) from S/A/B/C/D to the new 10-tier system: LT5, HT5, LT4, HT4, LT3, HT3, LT2, HT2, LT1, HT1. Update the Player type, all tier enumerations, tier config objects, TIER_CONFIG exports, color mappings, and any tier-specific logic so that the new tiers are used exclusively. Assign distinct vivid accent colors to each new tier (e.g. gradient from gold tones for HT1 down to grey-blue for LT5) consistent with the existing dark gaming theme.

Remove all pre-seeded player data from the backend so that the tier list and leaderboard display an empty state by default. The backend actor should initialise with zero players. Update the HomePage to show zero counts per tier and an empty top-3 preview.

Add a Category filter UI to the top of both the Tier List page and the Leaderboard page. The filter must display 9 options: 'All' (default, selected on load) plus the 8 categories: Sword, Axe, Crystal, Mace, Spearmace, Diamond SMP, UCH, SMP. Selecting a category filters the displayed players/entries to only those belonging to that category in real time. Selecting 'All' shows all categories combined.

Update the React Query hooks in `useQueries.ts` to accept an optional category parameter and pass it to the backend when filtering. Ensure the queries re-fetch automatically when the selected category changes.

Rename all frontend occurrences of the 'UCH' category label to 'UHC': update the CategoryFilter component options array, any category mapping/config objects, display labels in the Tier List page, Leaderboard page, and any other component or utility that references the string 'UCH'.

Create a new Admin page at the route `/admin` (file `frontend/src/pages/AdminPage.tsx`). On first visit (or when not authenticated), render a full-screen password gate: a centered card with a password input field and a 'Login' button. When the user submits the password `65515616151`, store the authenticated state in React component state (or sessionStorage) and reveal the management UI. If the password is wrong, show an inline error message. Include a 'Logout' button in the management UI that returns to the password gate.

Inside the Admin management UI (shown after successful password entry), render an 'Add Player' form with the following fields: Player Name (text input), Tier (dropdown/select with all 10 tiers: LT5, HT5, LT4, HT4, LT3, HT3, LT2, HT2, LT1, HT1), Category (dropdown/select with all 8 categories: Sword, Axe, Crystal, Mace, Spearmace, Diamond SMP, UHC, SMP), and Rating Score (number input). On form submission, call the backend `addPlayer` function via the React Query mutation and show a success notification. Clear the form after a successful submission.

Register the `/admin` route in `frontend/src/App.tsx` (TanStack Router) so that navigating to `/admin` renders `AdminPage`. Do not add an 'Admin' link to the shared Navbar — the admin area should only be accessible by direct URL.

On the Admin page (`frontend/src/pages/AdminPage.tsx`), inside the management UI (visible after successful login), display the full current `/admin` URL as a copyable text element. Derive the URL dynamically using `window.location.origin + '/admin'`. Render it in a styled read-only input or code block accompanied by a 'Copy' button that copies the URL to the clipboard via the Clipboard API and shows a brief 'Copied!' confirmation feedback (e.g. for 2 seconds). This element should be clearly labelled, e.g. 'Admin URL'.

new_feature_requests.summary: Replace tier system from S/A/B/C/D to LT5/HT5/LT4/HT4/LT3/HT3/LT2/HT2/LT1/HT1 across all pages and components
Ensure the tier list and leaderboard display no player entries (empty state) by default

Add Category filter (Sword, Axe, Crystal, Mace, Spearmace, Diamond SMP, UCH, SMP) to Tier List and Leaderboard pages, with each player belonging to a category and an 'All' default view showing all categories combined

Extend the backend Player type to include a `category` field with the following 8 variants: Sword, Axe, Crystal, Mace, Spearmace, DiamondSMP, UCH, SMP. Update the `addPlayer` method signature and all related query/filter methods to support filtering by category. Persist the category value for each player.
Rename category 'UCH' to 'UHC' across frontend labels, backend category variants, filter buttons, and all related logic

Rename the category variant from 'UCH' to 'UHC' in the backend Motoko actor: update the Category type variant tag from `#UCH` to `#UHC`, and update all references to it in player filtering, query methods, and any hardcoded string representations.
Create a separate password-protected Admin/Management area (password: 65515616151) with a login gate and a form to add players (name, tier, category, rating score) to the list

Add an `addPlayer` update function to the backend Motoko actor (if not already present) that accepts a player name (Text), tier (Tier variant), category (Category variant), and rating score (Nat), creates a new Player record, inserts it into the player map, and returns the newly created Player.
Display the full /admin URL as a clickable, copyable link on the Admin page so users can easily copy and paste it
